sentence: We came, we saw... and we were told to get out of the girls locker room.
explanation: In this context, saw refers to witnessing something
first_new_sentence: I saw a beautiful sunset yesterday.
second_new_sentence: I saw the doctor for my regular check-up.

sentence: My new thesaurus just came in not only is it terrible but its also terrible.
first_new_sentence: The storm last night was terrible.
second_new_sentence: The terrible news shocked the entire community.

sentence: What is a jewish dilemma ? free ham.
explanation: The term free means without cost
first_new_sentence: Let me know if you want to join us for a free concert.
second_new_sentence: I feel free to express my opinions on this matter.

sentence: What do you call a cowshed in arabic? a mubarak
explanation: In this context, shed refers to a structure for storage
first_new_sentence: I decided to shed some of my old clothes.
second_new_sentence: He was relieved to shed the responsibilities of his previous job.

sentence: What do you use to gamble on vacation? pair-a-dice!
explanation: Pair in this context means two of a kind
first_new_sentence: I bought a new pair of shoes for the trip.
second_new_sentence: They decided to form a pair for the dance competition.

sentence: This CSV format includes the jokes that have two meanings for a single word strictly under the defined conditions. Each entry provides context for both meanings of the selected word.
